sen.j: 安土町（あづちちょう）は、滋賀県東部の、琵琶湖東岸に位置する町。
sen.e: Azuchi-cho is located on the east bank of Lake Biwa in the east part of Shiga Prefecture.
Azuchi Town is located on the east bank of Lake Biwa in the east part of Shiga Prefecture.
Azuchi Town is located on the east bank of Lake Biwa in the east part of Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 日本史の時代区分の一つである安土桃山時代の語源ともなった安土城が建てられた地として知られる。
sen.e: The origin of Japanese historical period 'the Azuchi-Momoyama period' is Azuchi-jo Castle which was built in Azuchi-cho.
It is known as the place where the Azuchi-jo Castle was built which is the word origin of Japanese historical period 'the Azuchi-Momoyama period.'
It is known as the place where the Azuchi-jo Castle was built which is the word origin of Japanese historical period 'the Azuchi-Momoyama period.'

sen.j: 共通語ではしばしば「あ」を高く読む頭高型で発音されるが、地元でのアクセントは「あづち」とすべての音を高く読む平板型である。
sen.e: Although Azuchi-cho is often pronounced with a high falling intonation in the Japanese common language, it is pronounced without inflection in the local language.
Although Azuchi Town is often pronounced with a high falling intonation in the Japanese common language, it is pronounced without inflection in the local language.
Although Azuchi Town is often pronounced with a high falling intonation in the Japanese common language, it is pronounced without inflection in the local language.

sen.j: 1954年 蒲生郡安土村と老蘇村が合併して安土町が成立。
sen.e: In 1954, Azuchi-cho was established by the merger of Azuchi-mura, Gamo-gun and Oiso-mura.
1954: Azuchi Town was established by the merger of Azuchi Village and Oiso Village in Gamo County.
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: 1954: Azuchi Town was established by the merger of Azuchi Village and Oiso Village in Gamo County.

sen.j: 1955年 清水鼻地区を神崎郡 (滋賀県)五個荘町（現東近江市）に編入。
sen.e: In 1955, Shimizuhana district was incorporated into Gokasho Town (now Higashiomi City), Kanzaki-gun (Shiga Prefecture).
1955: Shimizuhana district was incorporated into Gokasho Town (now Higashiomi City), Kanzaki County (Shiga Prefecture).
sen.cmt: コロンを使用しました。
sen.e: 1955: Shimizuhana district was incorporated into Gokasho Town (now Higashiomi City), Kanzaki County (Shiga Prefecture).

sen.j: 安土城を中心とする歴史については、安土城を参照。
sen.e: Refer to "Azuchi-jo Castle" for the history centering on Azuchi-jo Castle.

sen.j: 料理や郷土史の学習を推進している。

sen.j: 町の歴史や文化の継承に資することを目的として建設。
